ExecutableTestSuite.label: Conformance class: Reference systems, Elevation
ExecutableTestSuite.description:
This test suite examines a data set against the theme-specific requirements related to reference systems.

This is a draft version. It has limitations and is expected to contain errors. Please report any issues or problems in GitHub.

Known limitations are documented in the description of the applicable test case or test assertion. There is a general limitation in all assertions that extensions in additional application schemas are only supported, if the unqualified name of the feature type in the extension is the same as the name of the feature type in the INSPIRE application schema.

Source: Conformance Class 'Reference systems, Elevation'

Pre-requisite conformance classes:
  • Conformance Class 'Reference systems'
ExecutableTestSuite.author: Consortium Bilbomatica, Guadaltel y Geograma

ParameterList.name: ETF Standard Parameters for XML test objects

TestCase.label: Specific requirements
TestCase.description: Verify that the following specic requirements on reference systems are meet.

TestAssertion.label: el-rs.a.1: Sea waters
TestAssertion.description:
For measuring the depth of the sea floor where there is an appreciable tidal range (tidal waters), the Lowest Astronomical Tide (LAT) shall be used as reference surface. For measuring the depth of the sea floor in marine areas without an appreciable tidal range, in open oceans and in waters that are deeper than 200 meters, the depth of the sea floor shall be referenced to the Mean Sea Level (MSL), or to a well-defined reference level close to the MSL.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Annex III, Section 1.7.5 (1): For measuring the depth of the sea floor where there is an appreciable tidal range (tidal waters), the Lowest Astronomical Tide(LAT) shall be used as reference surface.
  • IR Requirement Annex III, Section 1.7.5 (2): For measuring the depth of the sea floor in marine areas without an appreciable tidal range, in open oceans and effectively in waters that are deeper than 200 meters, the depth of the sea floor shall be referenced to the Mean Sea Level(MSL), or to a well defined reference level close to the MSL.
Source: Conformance class: Reference systems, Elevation, INSPIRE Data Specification on Elevation, A.2

TestAssertion.label: el-rs.a.2: Inland waters
TestAssertion.description:
The height of the reference level to which the depth of the floor of an inland water body is measured shall be referred to a gravity-related vertical reference system. This shall be the European Vertical Reference System (EVRS) for the areas within the geographical scope of EVRS, or the gravity-related vertical reference system identified by the Member State outside the scope of EVRS.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Annex III, Section 1.7.5 (3): The height of the reference level to which the depth of the floor of an inland water body is measured shall be referred to a gravity-related vertical reference system. This shall be the European Vertical Reference System(EVRS) for the area within the geographical scope of EVRS, or the gravity-related vertical reference system identified by the Member State outside the scope of EVRS.
Source: Conformance class: Reference systems, Elevation, INSPIRE Data Specification on Elevation, A.2

TestAssertion.label: el-rs.a.3: Integrated land-sea models
TestAssertion.description:
When providing an integrated land-sea elevation model, only one elevation property (either height or depth) shall be modelled, and its values shall be referenced to a single vertical coordinate reference system.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Annex III, Section 1.7.5 (4): When providing an integrated land-sea elevation model, only one elevation property (either height or depth) shall be modelled, and its values shall be referenced to a single vertical coordinate reference system.
Source: Conformance class: Reference systems, Elevation, INSPIRE Data Specification on Elevation, A.2
